RelatedSentence: ( Photo : Reuters ) E - cigarettes have long been touted as a safe alternative to tobacco smoke , but a recent study proves that 's not the case .

According to a study conducted by the University of California , San Diego , nicotine - laden vapor from e - cigarettes makes the untreatable  MRSA superbug  more poisonous and weakens body 's ability to fight the multi-antibiotic resistant bug .

For the study , the researchers determined the effects of e - cigarette vapor when exposed to MRSA superbug .
Researchers found that e - cigarettes strengthened the bacteria .

It is believed that bugs perceived danger when exposed to the vapor .
They immediately boosted their defence mechanisms , making it more difficult to destroy them with antibiotics .

Electronic cigarette vapor induces MRSA to produce acids as a defense mechanism within the first 3 hours of exposure , which raises similarities to their mechanism against nitric oxide - one of the components of innate immune responses to infection , the researchers concluded .
